item.description: [[named_reactions]] Amidine-Condensation-EWG1-Carboxyl-and-EWG2-Carboxyl References: [0]‚ÄÇJust a moment… Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon

[[Electrophilic-Addition]] Alkene-with-Halogen-Addition-Acidification-Nu-Iodine-and-Hal-Chlorine References: [0]‚ÄÇAlkene Reactivity Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon, Vinyl-Group R2 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon, Vinyl-Group
[[Other]] Alkyne-Addition-El-Chlorine-and-Nu-Chlorine References: [0]‚ÄÇSynthesis (5) - Reactions of Alkynes ‚Äì Master Organic Chemistry Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon

[[Additions]] Halogenation-Allylic-Succinimides-X-Bromine References: [0]‚ÄÇN-BromoSuccinimide (NBS) As A Reagent In Organic Chemistry Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon, Vinyl-Group, A-Alkoxide

[[Additions]] Michael-Addition-EWG1-Alkane-and-EWG2-Carboxyl-EWG3-Ester References: [0]‚ÄÇMichael Addition [1]‚ÄÇJSCT_v11-6.pdf Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon

[[Nucleophilic-Addition]] Carbonyl-Nucleophilic-Addition-Basic-Nu-Nitrile References: [0]‚ÄÇCarbonyl Mechanisms: Neutral Nucleophiles, Part¬†1 ‚Äì Master Organic Chemistry [1]‚ÄÇ19.4 Nucleophilic Addition Reactions of Aldehydes and Ketones - Chemistry LibreTexts

[[named_reactions]] Krapcho-Decarboxylation-GWE-Carboxyl References: [0]‚ÄÇKrapcho Decarboxylation Condition to enforce: R1 = L-A R2 = L-A R3 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon

Title: [[Named Reactions]] [[Libraries]] Definition: A Chemical transformation of one (or more) compounds into one (or more) different compounds that represents a reaction that can be distilled from at least one, but in general more than one elementary steps.

[[Other]] Indole-Synthesis-(1) References: [0]‚ÄÇPotassium tert-Butoxide Promoted Intramolecular Amination of 1-Aryl-2- (2-nitrobenzylidene)hydrazines: Efficient Synthesis of 1-Aryl-1H-indazoles Indole-Synthesis-(Nenitzescu) References: [0]‚ÄÇNenitzescu Indole Synthesis
[[named_reactions]] Formylation-Alpha-Bromo References: [0]‚ÄÇHaloform Reaction Condition to enforce: R1 = A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon, L-A R2 = A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon, L-A

[[Other]] ozonolysis-alkyne References: [0]‚ÄÇOzonolysis - Criegee Mechanism [1]‚ÄÇAlkene Reactions: Ozonolysis ‚Äì Master Organic Chemistry [2]‚ÄÇAlkene Reactions: Ozonolysis ‚Äì Master Organic Chemistry
[[Other]] Rubottom-Oxidation References: [0]‚ÄÇRubottom Oxidation Condition to enforce: R1 = L-A, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = L-A, A-Aromatic-Carbon R3 = L-A, A-Aromatic-Carbon

[[Rearrangements]] Buchner-Ring-Expansion-(O) References: [0]‚ÄÇPericyclic reaction - Wikipedia Special Conditions : SIDE REACTION Oxy-Cope-Rearrangement References: [0]‚ÄÇCope rearrangement - Wikipedia
[[named_reactions]] Lossen-Rearrangement References: [0]‚ÄÇLossen rearrangement - Wikipedia Condition to enforce: R1 = L-A, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = L-A, A-Aromatic-Carbon

[[Substitutions]] Reimer-Tiemann-Formylation References: [0]‚ÄÇReimer-Tiemann Formylation Benzene-Nitration References: [0]‚ÄÇNitration of Benzene and Methylbenzene - Chemistry LibreTexts [1]‚ÄÇNitration - Wikipedia

[[Nucleophilic-Substitutions]] Nucleophilic Acyl Substitution is a reaction that carboxylic acid derivatives undergo. It is a 2-step mechanism that involves nucleophilic addition and leaving group removal.

[[Nucleophilic-Substitutions]] Nucleophilic-Aliphatic-Substitution-Beta-acid-EWG1-Alkane-and-EWG2-Carbonyl-Lg-Chlorine References: [0]‚ÄÇAcetoacetic-Ester Synthesis [1]‚ÄÇSubstituted carbonyl compound synthesis by alkylation or condensation [2]‚ÄÇMalonic Ester Synthesis [3]‚ÄÇCarbonyl alpha-substitution reactions - Wikipedia

[[Nucleophilic-Substitutions]] A nucleophile (Nu-) attack an electron poor aromatic molecule, resulting in the substitution of a leaving group Works well with electron withdrawing groups (EWG), such as NO2, since it activates the ring The EWGs work well in the ortho or para positions since the Nu- puts a negative charge on the ring and the EWG can help stabilize it https://www.

[[Substitutions]] Aziridine-Ring-Opening-Nu-Chlorine-acid References: [0]‚ÄÇAziridines - Wikipedia Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon

[[named_reactions]] Horner-Wadsworth-Emmons-Reaction-EWG-Carboxyl References: [0]‚ÄÇHorner‚ÄìWadsworth‚ÄìEmmons reaction - Wikipedia Condition to enforce: R1 = H, A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon R2 = A-Aliphatic-Carbon, A-Aromatic-Carbon

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: ‚Äú[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)
